intro: Odontocarya ulei, commonly known as the African milkwood tree, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and lance-shaped leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by fleshy, red berries. It is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy species in regions with low rainfall. The plant has traditional uses in local medicine and is also valued for its timber and as a source of shade.
